Social Listening Details

The application must be integrated with Facebook and Twitter for the post to be listed in Social Listening page. Refer to the Social Media Configuration Guide for details.

Social listening helps to keep track of social following through channels such as Facebook and Twitter. This page provides a view of the feeds and messages from the customers across all channels.

Benefits of social listening is as follows:

  • Direct view and posting of feeds to the customer on the social media platforms.
  • Monitor engagement of your posts.
  • Get the actual active feeds that require attention for the day.
  • Ability to filter the feeds based on the social media selection. Example: Select Twitter to view feeds only from Twitter.
  • Resolution time for customer issues reduces.

Navigate to left quick access pane and click Social to view the Social Listening page. This page is categorized in the following way: 

  • Social Metrics
  • Social Feed List (Left Panel)
  • Viewing the feed/messages (Central Panel)
  • CSR social response panel (Right panel)

Social Metrics

The social metrics computes and displays the data for feeds that are active or completed. It also displays the Facebook and Twitter feed count.

  • Active - Number of feeds that are open and require intervention by the CSR.
  • Done Today- Number of feeds that have been resolved today.
  • Facebook Today - Total number of posts, comments and messages posted in Facebook for the organization profile. The number of post gives the CSR an estimate of the volume of posts that will line up in the Active section during the day.
  • Twitter Today - Total number or tweets, comments, re-tweets in Twitter for the organization profile. 
Notifications

The Notifications feature enables the CSRs to view the notifications (open cases) associated with the customers. 

  1. In the upper right corner of the page, click the Notifications drop-down arrow to view the notification panel.
  2. The notification panel displays the open cases for the selected customer.
  3. Click on each notification to display the corresponding case details. 

Social Feed list

The social feed list is on the left panel of the screen. This section contains two tabs

Active and Done - Both the tabs list all the posts and messages from Facebook and twitter. The CSR can filter the posts in both the tabs using the following radio buttons

  • All - Select to list all the feeds to the organization which is in active state.
  • Feed - Select only the posts that have come from the social media channel. The list is displayed based on the filter selection made to the social media channels. For example, select Facebook check box to view only Facebook related posts.
  • Message - Select to view only messages.

Viewing the feed/messages 

Details of the selected post from the list is displayed in this panel. 

Feed- This section displays the complete thread of posts, replies and comments. The image of the product is also displayed and corresponding case number if any is associated with the feed.

Message - This section displays the complete conversation thread  through the messenger between the CSR and customer. 

Associate a customer with a feed/message.

When we have a feed or message from an existing customer through a social media platform, we must assign the feed to the customer in the application. To associate the feed with a customer, perform the following steps:

  1. Filter the feed and select the required post
  2. In the Attach a Customer section, enter the name of the customer in the Search Customer edit box and click .
  3. Select the customer name from the populated list. Click Attach. 

Replying to a customer

The CSR will reply to the customer for the social media post using this section.

  1. Filter the feed and select the required post
  2. The details of the post are displayed.
  3. In the reply to customer section, enter the details in the edit box.
  4. Select the Follow-up tag if this post/issue by the customer requires more time and will be resolved at a future date. Click More and create a case for the issue.
  5. Select a Reason from the drop-down list. The options available in the drop-down list Store Enquiry, Gift wrap message, promotion and so on.
  6. Select a Resolution from the drop-down list. Resolution is the method by which the issue has been resolved. For example- order modification, appeasement etc.
  7. Enter notes related to the case if required.
  8. Click Done.
